artist: Yoshida Hiroshi (self-published); Carved by Maeda Yūjirō
creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by H. Ed Robison, in memory of his beloved wife Ulrike Pietzner Robison
description: twilight or sunrise seascape: blue rock formation in foreground; grey seascape (resembles cloudbank) and purple rock formation in middle ground; pink, orange, and grey sky in background
marks: left: 自摺　昭和三年作　日本南アルプス集　雨後の八ヶ岳 (駒ヶ岳石室より) {Jizuri,  LRC: よし田 {Yoshida}
medium: Woodblock print; ink and color on paper
title: Yatsugatake after Rain (Seen from Ishimuro, Komagatake)
